trans-unit.target: Procedura: creare assembly Friend non firmati (Visual Basic) | Documenti di Microsoft

trans-unit.source: How to: Create Unsigned Friend Assemblies (Visual Basic)
trans-unit.target: Procedura: creare assembly Friend non firmati (Visual Basic)

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use friend assemblies with assemblies that are unsigned.
trans-unit.target: In questo esempio viene illustrato come utilizzare gli assembly friend con assembly non firmati.

trans-unit.source: To create an assembly and a friend assembly
trans-unit.target: Per creare un assembly e un assembly friend

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Aprire un prompt dei comandi.

trans-unit.source: Create a Visual Basic file named `friend_signed_A.` that contains the following code.
trans-unit.target: Creare un file di Visual Basic denominato `friend_signed_A.` che contiene il codice seguente.

trans-unit.source: The code uses the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute> attribute to declare friend_signed_B as a friend assembly.
trans-unit.target: Il codice utilizza il <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>attributo per dichiarare friend_signed_B come assembly friend.</xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>

trans-unit.source: Compile and sign friend_signed_A by using the following command.
trans-unit.target: Compilare e firmare friend_signed_A utilizzando il comando seguente.

trans-unit.source: Create a Visual Basic file named `friend_unsigned_B` that contains the following code.
trans-unit.target: Creare un file di Visual Basic denominato `friend_unsigned_B` che contiene il codice seguente.

trans-unit.source: Because friend_unsigned_A specifies friend_unsigned_B as a friend assembly, the code in friend_unsigned_B can access `Friend` types and members from friend_unsigned_A.
trans-unit.target: Poiché friend_unsigned_A specifica friend_unsigned_B come assembly friend, il codice di friend_unsigned_B può accedere `Friend` tipi e membri da friend_unsigned_A.

trans-unit.source: Compile friend_signed_B by using the following command.
trans-unit.target: Compilare friend_signed_B utilizzando il comando seguente.

trans-unit.source: The name of the assembly that is generated by the compiler must match the friend assembly name that is passed to the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute> attribute.
trans-unit.target: Il nome dell'assembly generato dal compilatore deve corrispondere il nome dell'assembly friend che viene passato per il <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>attributo.</xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>

trans-unit.source: You can explicitly set the assembly by using the `/out` compiler option.
trans-unit.target: È possibile impostare in modo esplicito l'assembly utilizzando il `/out` l'opzione del compilatore.

trans-unit.source: Run the friend_signed_B.exe file.
trans-unit.target: Eseguire il file friend_signed_B.exe.

trans-unit.source: The program prints two strings: "Class1.Test" and "Class2.Test".
trans-unit.target: Il programma stampa due stringhe: "Class1" e "Class2. test".

trans-unit.source: .NET Framework Security
trans-unit.target: Sicurezza di .NET Framework

trans-unit.source: There are similarities between the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute> attribute and the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission> class.
trans-unit.target: Esistono analogie tra l' <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>attributo e la <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission>classe.</xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission> </xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>

trans-unit.source: The main difference is that <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission> can demand security permissions to run a particular section of code, whereas the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute> attribute controls the visibility of `Friend` types and members.
trans-unit.target: La differenza principale è che <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission>può richiedere le autorizzazioni di sicurezza per l'esecuzione di una particolare sezione di codice, mentre il <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute>attributo controlla la visibilità di `Friend` tipi e membri.</xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.InternalsVisibleToAttribute> </xref:System.Security.Permissions.StrongNameIdentityPermission>

trans-unit.target: Vedere anche
